actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on February 10, 2026.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Haridopolos moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 395
actions-list.actionItem: 2 (Roll no. 58).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1531 — "To direct certain financial regulators to exclude representatives of the People's Republic of China from certain banking organizations upon notice of certain threats or danger, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 390
actions-list.actionItem: 9 (Roll no. 57).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 6644 — "A bill to increase the supply of housing in America, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Donald S. Beyer, Jr. Mr. Beyer submitted his resignation from the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. The resignation was accepted without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3190.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3190 — "To amend the Burma Unified through Rigorous Military Accountability Act of 2022 to extend the sunset, to require a determination with respect to the imposition of sanctions on certain persons of Burma, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1531.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1531 — "To direct certain financial regulators to exclude representatives of the People's Republic of China from certain banking organizations upon notice of certain threats or danger, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3390.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3390 — "To amend the Federal Reserve Act to require the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to carry out a review of discount window operations and to implement improvements to such operations, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3682.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3682 — "To amend the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to require the Financial Stability Oversight Council to consider alternative approaches before determining that a U.S. nonbank financial company shall be supervised by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6644.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 6644 — "A bill to increase the supply of housing in America, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5616.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hill (AR) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5616 — "To amend title 31, United States Code, to require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue $2.50 numismatic coins and $2.50 circulating coins, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3705.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Bice moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3705 — "To provide for the creation of a congressional time capsule in commemoration of the semiquincentennial of the United States, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Adrian Smith to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
